page.title: 02Dairy Farming
page.content: One of the farms in our area is a Dairy farm belonging to Mr. R. Corby. He employs one full time cowman and four part-time people, his wife doing the accounts. The farm extends to 138 acres. There are 84 cows, 74 in milk, most of which are Fresian and a Hereford bull. Some of the 70 calves are Fresian X Hereford. The Fresian heifers are reared for milking, the bull and cross calves are sold on Melton Mowbray market. The cows are milked twice daily in a herring bone parlour. They are fed on silage, carrots, concentrates and cabbage but are usually outside from May to November. Some milk is bottled and sold locally, the rest is sent to Peterborough by tanker. Mr. Corby's fields are fertilized to grow good grass for grazing and sileage.
